title: How to find a 3D model on the internet - Quora

response.answer_text: There are repositories of models available, however ‘finding’ a desired model is not easy, they often have no internal search function on such sites, or have badly labelled models making actually making use of the sites awkward. Instead I start my search on Google and use the following to perform the search (for this example remove the square brackets, but keep the formatting as is): [model descripion] +obj +3ds +download that search should return a pretty strong hit on the pages of model repositories with the matching subject model you are looking for, you may have to go through the top dozen or so google results to actually find one. Additionally, if you aren’t inclined to pay for 3d models you can add +free at the end. Eventually you’ll find there are 3 or 4 major sites which provide 3d model downloads and you’ll become familiar with their designs and their own search functions.
Depends on the purpose: 3D models for 3D printing: Thingiverse MyMiniFactory Cults3D 3D models for game developers, visual effects studios, web, VR, etc: Turbosquid Sketchfab
